content.raw: I had earlier suggested exactly that, which was more-or-less embedding the SDF files in the library itself without grubbing around in the filesystem for it.  While I still think that has value, we will still need a replacement for boost::filesystem anyway.  For instance, in the code that reads in the URI for the model, we necessarily have to go grubbing around in the filesystem.  Thus, I think embedding the SDF files into the library is actually orthogonal to this.
